facts: A piano is both a string instrument and a percussion instrument because hammers strike strings to make sound.
The smallest common violin is the 1/16 size, made so young children can learn with an instrument that fits their arms.
A saxophone is made of brass but is classified as a woodwind instrument because it uses a reed to vibrate the air.
A drum can change pitch if you tighten or loosen the drumhead, which changes how fast it vibrates.
The pipe organ is one of the largest instruments in the world and can have thousands of pipes of different sizes.
A standard concert flute makes sound when you blow across an opening, causing the air column inside to vibrate.
An electric guitar needs an amplifier to be very loud because its pickups turn string vibrations into an electrical signal.
